Qualifiers.scope: Site planning regulations concerning the setbacks of attached garages and carports.
ambiguity_flags: The rule text specifies 'Attached garages', but the page title is 'Attached garages/carports site planning'. It is ambiguous whether the rule applies equally to attached carports.

Variables.name: structure_type
Variables.description: The type of structure being built.

Variables.name: setback_type
Variables.description: The specific yard setback being measured.

Variables.name: garage_setback_dimension
Variables.description: The required setback for the attached garage/carport, which is dependent on the main dwelling's setback.

Variables.name: main_dwelling_setback_dimension
Variables.description: The required setback for the main dwelling on the lot, which serves as the reference value.

Conditions.statement: Attached garages must comply with the same setbacks as the main dwelling.
Conditions.logical_representation: FOR EACH setback_type IN ['front', 'rear', 'side', 'street-side'], garage_setback_dimension(setback_type) MUST_EQUAL main_dwelling_setback_dimension(setback_type)

Exceptions.description: No explicit deviations or alternatives are mentioned in the text.

Relationships.hierarchical: This rule is a primary regulation under the topic 'Attached garages/carports site planning'.

cross_references.description: The rule requires referencing the setback specifications applicable to the 'main dwelling' on the same lot.

logical_dependencies: Validation of an attached garage's setbacks is dependent on obtaining the setback requirements for the main dwelling.

Qualifiers.scope: Siting of uncovered parking spaces on a residential lot.
Qualifiers.applicability: Applies to 'Uncovered spaces', which are understood to be parking spaces in this context.
Qualifiers.exclusions: The rule does not specify constraints for rear yards or interior side yards.
ambiguity_flags: The phrasing '...beyond the required frontyard and beyond the first 10' of the street-side yard' is slightly ambiguous. The interpretation, supported by diagrammatic evidence ('No-parking area' on corner lot), is that these are two separate prohibited zones for any uncovered space. An alternative, less likely interpretation is that a space at the corner of a front and street-side yard must satisfy both conditions.

Variables.name: yard_type
Variables.description: The type of yard where the space is located.

Variables.name: required_frontyard_depth
Variables.description: The dimension of the required front yard setback, which defines a prohibited zone.

Constants.name: street_side_yard_no_parking_depth
Constants.description: The depth of the prohibited zone for uncovered parking within a street-side yard, measured from the lot line.

Conditions.statement: Uncovered spaces must be located beyond the required frontyard and beyond the first 10' of the street-side yard.
Conditions.logical_representation: location(uncovered_space) MUST NOT BE WITHIN area(required_frontyard) AND location(uncovered_space) MUST NOT BE WITHIN area(street_side_yard_first_10_feet)

Exceptions.description: No formal exceptions are listed, but Figure 33 illustrates compliant locations for uncovered spaces, such as in a driveway (beyond the front setback) or in an interior side yard.

Relationships.hierarchical: This rule is a primary regulation under the topic 'Attached garages/carports site planning'.

cross_references.description: Compliance requires referencing the 'required frontyard' setback dimension for the specific lot.
This rule governs spaces that are often supplementary to enclosed garage spaces regulated by RG-G44-01.

logical_dependencies: The examples in Figure 33 (A, B, C) imply a dependency on an unstated total parking requirement (e.g., 2 spaces per dwelling). The presence of uncovered spaces is shown to be contingent on the number of enclosed garage spaces (e.g., 1-car garages are shown with a 2nd uncovered space, while a 2-car garage is not).
